New Records: Australia set the highest-ever T20 international first powerplay score of 113/1 for the opening six overs.
Key Match Events: Australia defeated Scotland by 70 runs to win the second T20I and take an unassailable 2-0 lead in the three-match series.
Josh Inglis scored a blistering century to propel Australia to 196/4 in 20 overs.
Marcus Stoinis was the pick of the Australian bowlers, taking 4/23 from 3.4 overs.
Travis Head recorded a golden duck.
In the series opener, Travis Head smashed 80 off 25 balls as Australia chased down Scotland’s 154.
Mitchell Marsh smashed 30 off one over from Jack Jarvis.
Head reached his half century from just 17 balls.
Josh Inglis' quick-fire unbeaten 27 helped earn Australia a seven-wicket victory with 62 balls to spare.
Sean Abbott was the pick of the Australia bowlers with three for 39 in the T20 World Cup match in June.
Brandon McMullen’s wicket led to a massive collapse as Scotland lost their last 6 wickets for just 20 runs in the span of 26 balls.
Marcus Stoinis wrapped up the match with his fourth wicket.
Post-Match Reflections: Australia put the series to bed with a clinical win.
The series is in the bag for Australia, with a match still to go, allowing them to try out some other faces in the squad.
